intro: Scabiosa columbaria var. prolifera, commonly known as the nodding scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers with five petals, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and wildflower meadows.
